intro: Chiococca jefensis, commonly known as the Jefén Jefén, is a climbing shrub native to the Amazon rainforest of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, spherical berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary growth areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
